14
15#ifndef DNS_RDATA_H
16#define DNS_RDATA_H 1
17
18/*****
19 ***** Module Info
20 *****/
21
22/*! \file dns/rdata.h
23 * \brief
24 * Provides facilities for manipulating DNS rdata, including conversions to
25 * and from wire format and text format.
26 *
27 * Given the large amount of rdata possible in a nameserver, it was important
28 * to come up with a very efficient way of storing rdata, but at the same
29 * time allow it to be manipulated.
30 *
31 * The decision was to store rdata in uncompressed wire format,
32 * and not to make it a fully abstracted object; i.e. certain parts of the
33 * server know rdata is stored that way. This saves a lot of memory, and
34 * makes adding rdata to messages easy. Having much of the server know
35 * the representation would be perilous, and we certainly don't want each
36 * user of rdata to be manipulating such a low-level structure. This is
37 * where the rdata module comes in. The module allows rdata handles to be
38 * created and attached to uncompressed wire format regions. All rdata
39 * operations and conversions are done through these handles.
40 *
41 * Implementation Notes:
42 *
43 *\li The routines in this module are expected to be synthesized by the
44 * build process from a set of source files, one per rdata type. For
45 * portability, it's probably best that the building be done by a C
46 * program. Adding a new rdata type will be a simple matter of adding
47 * a file to a directory and rebuilding the server. *All* knowledge of
48 * the format of a particular rdata type is in this file.
49 *
50 * MP:
51 *\li Clients of this module must impose any required synchronization.
52 *
53 * Reliability:
54 *\li This module deals with low-level byte streams. Errors in any of
55 * the functions are likely to crash the server or corrupt memory.
56 *
57 *\li Rdata is typed, and the caller must know what type of rdata it has.
58 * A caller that gets this wrong could crash the server.
59 *
60 *\li The fromstruct() and tostruct() routines use a void * pointer to
61 * represent the structure. The caller must ensure that it passes a
62 * pointer to the appropriate type, or the server could crash or memory
63 * could be corrupted.
64 *
65 * Resources:
66 *\li None.
67 *
68 * Security:
69 *
70 *\li *** WARNING ***
71 * dns_rdata_fromwire() deals with raw network data. An error in
72 * this routine could result in the failure or hijacking of the server.
73 *
74 * Standards:
75 *\li RFC1035
76 *\li Draft EDNS0 (0)
77 *\li Draft EDNS1 (0)
78 *\li Draft Binary Labels (2)
79 *\li Draft Local Compression (1)
80 *\li Various RFCs for particular types; these will be documented in the
81 * sources files of the types.
82 *
83 */
84
85/***
86 *** Imports
87 ***/
88
89#include <stdbool.h>
90
91#include <isc/lang.h>
92
93#include <dns/types.h>
94#include <dns/name.h>
95#include <dns/message.h>
96
97ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
98
99
100/***
101 *** Types
102 ***/
103
104/*%
105 ***** An 'rdata' is a handle to a binary region. The handle has an RR
106 ***** class and type, and the data in the binary region is in the format
107 ***** of the given class and type.
108 *****/
109/*%
110 * Clients are strongly discouraged from using this type directly, with
111 * the exception of the 'link' field which may be used directly for whatever
112 * purpose the client desires.
113 */
114struct dns_rdata {
115 unsigned char * data;
116 unsigned int length;
117 dns_rdataclass_t rdclass;
118 dns_rdatatype_t type;
119 unsigned int flags;
120 ISC_LINK(dns_rdata_t) link;
121};
122
123#define DNS_RDATA_INIT { NULL, 0, 0, 0, 0, {(void*)(-1), (void *)(-1)}}
124
125#define DNS_RDATA_CHECKINITIALIZED
126#ifdef DNS_RDATA_CHECKINITIALIZED
127#define DNS_RDATA_INITIALIZED(rdata) \
128 ((rdata)->data == NULL && (rdata)->length == 0 && \
129 (rdata)->rdclass == 0 && (rdata)->type == 0 && (rdata)->flags == 0 && \
130 !ISC_LINK_LINKED((rdata), link))
131#else
132#ifdef ISC_LIST_CHECKINIT
133#define DNS_RDATA_INITIALIZED(rdata) \
134 (!ISC_LINK_LINKED((rdata), link))
135#else
136#define DNS_RDATA_INITIALIZED(rdata) true
137#endif
138#endif
139
140#define DNS_RDATA_UPDATE 0x0001 /*%< update pseudo record. */
141#define DNS_RDATA_OFFLINE 0x0002 /*%< RRSIG has a offline key. */
142
143#define DNS_RDATA_VALIDFLAGS(rdata) \
144 (((rdata)->flags & ~(DNS_RDATA_UPDATE|DNS_RDATA_OFFLINE)) == 0)
145
146/*
147 * The maximum length of a RDATA that can be sent on the wire.
148 * Max packet size (65535) less header (12), less name (1), type (2),
149 * class (2), ttl(4), length (2).
150 *
151 * None of the defined types that support name compression can exceed
152 * this and all new types are to be sent uncompressed.
153 */
154
155#define DNS_RDATA_MAXLENGTH 65512U
156
157/*
158 * Flags affecting rdata formatting style. Flags 0xFFFF0000
159 * are used by masterfile-level formatting and defined elsewhere.
160 * See additional comments at dns_rdata_tofmttext().
161 */
162
163/*% Split the rdata into multiple lines to try to keep it
164 within the "width". */
165#define DNS_STYLEFLAG_MULTILINE 0x00000001ULL
166
167/*% Output explanatory comments. */
168#define DNS_STYLEFLAG_COMMENT 0x00000002ULL
169#define DNS_STYLEFLAG_RRCOMMENT 0x00000004ULL
170
171/*% Output KEYDATA in human readable format. */
172#define DNS_STYLEFLAG_KEYDATA 0x00000008ULL
173
174/*% Output textual RR type and RDATA in RFC 3597 unknown format */
175#define DNS_STYLEFLAG_UNKNOWNFORMAT 0x00000010ULL
176
177#define DNS_RDATA_DOWNCASE DNS_NAME_DOWNCASE
178#define DNS_RDATA_CHECKNAMES DNS_NAME_CHECKNAMES
179#define DNS_RDATA_CHECKNAMESFAIL DNS_NAME_CHECKNAMESFAIL
180#define DNS_RDATA_CHECKREVERSE DNS_NAME_CHECKREVERSE
181#define DNS_RDATA_CHECKMX DNS_NAME_CHECKMX
182#define DNS_RDATA_CHECKMXFAIL DNS_NAME_CHECKMXFAIL
183#define DNS_RDATA_UNKNOWNESCAPE 0x80000000
184
185/***
186 *** Initialization
187 ***/
188
189void
190dns_rdata_init(dns_rdata_t *rdata);
191/*%<
192 * Make 'rdata' empty.
193 *
194 * Requires:
195 * 'rdata' is a valid rdata (i.e. not NULL, points to a struct dns_rdata)
196 */
197
198void
199dns_rdata_reset(dns_rdata_t *rdata);
200/*%<
201 * Make 'rdata' empty.
202 *
203 * Requires:
204 *\li 'rdata' is a previously initialized rdata and is not linked.
205 */
206
207void
208dns_rdata_clone(const dns_rdata_t *src, dns_rdata_t *target);
209/*%<
210 * Clone 'target' from 'src'.
211 *
212 * Requires:
213 *\li 'src' to be initialized.
214 *\li 'target' to be initialized.
215 */
216
217/***
218 *** Comparisons
219 ***/
220
221int
222dns_rdata_compare(const dns_rdata_t *rdata1, const dns_rdata_t *rdata2);
223/*%<
224 * Determine the relative ordering under the DNSSEC order relation of
225 * 'rdata1' and 'rdata2'.
226 *
227 * Requires:
228 *
229 *\li 'rdata1' is a valid, non-empty rdata
230 *
231 *\li 'rdata2' is a valid, non-empty rdata
232 *
233 * Returns:
234 *\li < 0 'rdata1' is less than 'rdata2'
235 *\li 0 'rdata1' is equal to 'rdata2'
236 *\li > 0 'rdata1' is greater than 'rdata2'
237 */
238
239int
240dns_rdata_casecompare(const dns_rdata_t *rdata1, const dns_rdata_t *rdata2);
241/*%<
242 * dns_rdata_casecompare() is similar to dns_rdata_compare() but also
243 * compares domain names case insensitively in known rdata types that
244 * are treated as opaque data by dns_rdata_compare().
245 *
246 * Requires:
247 *
248 *\li 'rdata1' is a valid, non-empty rdata
249 *
250 *\li 'rdata2' is a valid, non-empty rdata
251 *
252 * Returns:
253 *\li < 0 'rdata1' is less than 'rdata2'
254 *\li 0 'rdata1' is equal to 'rdata2'
255 *\li > 0 'rdata1' is greater than 'rdata2'
256 */
257
258/***
259 *** Conversions
260 ***/
261
262void
263dns_rdata_fromregion(dns_rdata_t *rdata, dns_rdataclass_t rdclass,
264 dns_rdatatype_t type, isc_region_t *r);
265/*%<
266 * Make 'rdata' refer to region 'r'.
267 *
268 * Requires:
269 *
270 *\li The data in 'r' is properly formatted for whatever type it is.
271 */
272
273void
274dns_rdata_toregion(const dns_rdata_t *rdata, isc_region_t *r);
275/*%<
276 * Make 'r' refer to 'rdata'.
277 */
278
279isc_result_t
280dns_rdata_fromwire(dns_rdata_t *rdata, dns_rdataclass_t rdclass,
281 dns_rdatatype_t type, isc_buffer_t *source,
282 dns_decompress_t *dctx, unsigned int options,
283 isc_buffer_t *target);
284/*%<
285 * Copy the possibly-compressed rdata at source into the target region.
286 *
287 * Notes:
288 *\li Name decompression policy is controlled by 'dctx'.
289 *
290 * 'options'
291 *\li DNS_RDATA_DOWNCASE downcase domain names when they are copied
292 * into target.
293 *
294 * Requires:
295 *
296 *\li 'rdclass' and 'type' are valid.
297 *
298 *\li 'source' is a valid buffer, and the active region of 'source'
299 * references the rdata to be processed.
300 *
301 *\li 'target' is a valid buffer.
302 *
303 *\li 'dctx' is a valid decompression context.
304 *
305 * Ensures,
306 * if result is success:
307 * \li If 'rdata' is not NULL, it is attached to the target.
308 * \li The conditions dns_name_fromwire() ensures for names hold
309 * for all names in the rdata.
310 * \li The current location in source is advanced, and the used space
311 * in target is updated.
312 *
313 * Result:
314 *\li Success
315 *\li Any non-success status from dns_name_fromwire()
316 *\li Various 'Bad Form' class failures depending on class and type
317 *\li Bad Form: Input too short
318 *\li Resource Limit: Not enough space
319 */
320
321isc_result_t
322dns_rdata_towire(dns_rdata_t *rdata, dns_compress_t *cctx,
323 isc_buffer_t *target);
324/*%<
325 * Convert 'rdata' into wire format, compressing it as specified by the
326 * compression context 'cctx', and storing the result in 'target'.
327 *
328 * Notes:
329 *\li If the compression context allows global compression, then the
330 * global compression table may be updated.
331 *
332 * Requires:
333 *\li 'rdata' is a valid, non-empty rdata
334 *
335 *\li target is a valid buffer
336 *
337 *\li Any offsets specified in a global compression table are valid
338 * for target.
339 *
340 * Ensures,
341 * if the result is success:
342 * \li The used space in target is updated.
343 *
344 * Returns:
345 *\li Success
346 *\li Any non-success status from dns_name_towire()
347 *\li Resource Limit: Not enough space
348 */
349
350isc_result_t
351dns_rdata_fromtext(dns_rdata_t *rdata, dns_rdataclass_t rdclass,
352 dns_rdatatype_t type, isc_lex_t *lexer,
353 const dns_name_t *origin, unsigned int options,
354 isc_mem_t *mctx,
355 isc_buffer_t *target, dns_rdatacallbacks_t *callbacks);
356/*%<
357 * Convert the textual representation of a DNS rdata into uncompressed wire
358 * form stored in the target region. Tokens constituting the text of the rdata
359 * are taken from 'lexer'.
360 *
361 * Notes:
362 *\li Relative domain names in the rdata will have 'origin' appended to them.
363 * A NULL origin implies "origin == dns_rootname".
364 *
365 *
366 * 'options'
367 *\li DNS_RDATA_DOWNCASE downcase domain names when they are copied
368 * into target.
369 *\li DNS_RDATA_CHECKNAMES perform checknames checks.
370 *\li DNS_RDATA_CHECKNAMESFAIL fail if the checknames check fail. If
371 * not set a warning will be issued.
372 *\li DNS_RDATA_CHECKREVERSE this should set if the owner name ends
373 * in IP6.ARPA, IP6.INT or IN-ADDR.ARPA.
374 *
375 * Requires:
376 *
377 *\li 'rdclass' and 'type' are valid.
378 *
379 *\li 'lexer' is a valid isc_lex_t.
380 *
381 *\li 'mctx' is a valid isc_mem_t.
382 *
383 *\li 'target' is a valid region.
384 *
385 *\li 'origin' if non NULL it must be absolute.
386 *
387 *\li 'callbacks' to be NULL or callbacks->warn and callbacks->error be
388 * initialized.
389 *
390 * Ensures,
391 * if result is success:
392 *\li If 'rdata' is not NULL, it is attached to the target.
393
394 *\li The conditions dns_name_fromtext() ensures for names hold
395 * for all names in the rdata.
396
397 *\li The used space in target is updated.
398 *
399 * Result:
400 *\li Success
401 *\li Translated result codes from isc_lex_gettoken
402 *\li Various 'Bad Form' class failures depending on class and type
403 *\li Bad Form: Input too short
404 *\li Resource Limit: Not enough space
405 *\li Resource Limit: Not enough memory
406 */
407
408isc_result_t
409dns_rdata_totext(dns_rdata_t *rdata, const dns_name_t *origin,
410 isc_buffer_t *target);
411/*%<
412 * Convert 'rdata' into text format, storing the result in 'target'.
413 * The text will consist of a single line, with fields separated by
414 * single spaces.
415 *
416 * Notes:
417 *\li If 'origin' is not NULL, then any names in the rdata that are
418 * subdomains of 'origin' will be made relative it.
419 *
420 *\li XXX Do we *really* want to support 'origin'? I'm inclined towards "no"
421 * at the moment.
422 *
423 * Requires:
424 *
425 *\li 'rdata' is a valid, non-empty rdata
426 *
427 *\li 'origin' is NULL, or is a valid name
428 *
429 *\li 'target' is a valid text buffer
430 *
431 * Ensures,
432 * if the result is success:
433 *
434 * \li The used space in target is updated.
435 *
436 * Returns:
437 *\li Success
438 *\li Any non-success status from dns_name_totext()
439 *\li Resource Limit: Not enough space
440 */
441
442isc_result_t
443dns_rdata_tofmttext(dns_rdata_t *rdata, const dns_name_t *origin,
444 dns_masterstyle_flags_t flags, unsigned int width,
445 unsigned int split_width, const char *linebreak,
446 isc_buffer_t *target);
447/*%<
448 * Like dns_rdata_totext, but do formatted output suitable for
449 * database dumps. This is intended for use by dns_db_dump();
450 * library users are discouraged from calling it directly.
451 *
452 * If (flags & #DNS_STYLEFLAG_MULTILINE) != 0, attempt to stay
453 * within 'width' by breaking the text into multiple lines.
454 * The string 'linebreak' is inserted between lines, and parentheses
455 * are added when necessary. Because RRs contain unbreakable elements
456 * such as domain names whose length is variable, unpredictable, and
457 * potentially large, there is no guarantee that the lines will
458 * not exceed 'width' anyway.
459 *
460 * If (flags & #DNS_STYLEFLAG_MULTILINE) == 0, the rdata is always
461 * printed as a single line, and no parentheses are used.
462 * The 'width' and 'linebreak' arguments are ignored.
463 *
464 * If (flags & #DNS_STYLEFLAG_COMMENT) != 0, output explanatory
465 * comments next to things like the SOA timer fields. Some
466 * comments (e.g., the SOA ones) are only printed when multiline
467 * output is selected.
468 *
469 * base64 rdata text (e.g., DNSKEY records) will be split into chunks
470 * of 'split_width' characters. If split_width == 0, the text will
471 * not be split at all. If split_width == UINT_MAX (0xffffffff), then
472 * it is undefined and falls back to the default value of 'width'
473 */
474
475isc_result_t
476dns_rdata_fromstruct(dns_rdata_t *rdata, dns_rdataclass_t rdclass,
477 dns_rdatatype_t type, void *source, isc_buffer_t *target);
478/*%<
479 * Convert the C structure representation of an rdata into uncompressed wire
480 * format in 'target'.
481 *
482 * XXX Should we have a 'size' parameter as a sanity check on target?
483 *
484 * Requires:
485 *
486 *\li 'rdclass' and 'type' are valid.
487 *
488 *\li 'source' points to a valid C struct for the class and type.
489 *
490 *\li 'target' is a valid buffer.
491 *
492 *\li All structure pointers to memory blocks should be NULL if their
493 * corresponding length values are zero.
494 *
495 * Ensures,
496 * if result is success:
497 * \li If 'rdata' is not NULL, it is attached to the target.
498 *
499 * \li The used space in 'target' is updated.
500 *
501 * Result:
502 *\li Success
503 *\li Various 'Bad Form' class failures depending on class and type
504 *\li Resource Limit: Not enough space
505 */
506
507isc_result_t
508dns_rdata_tostruct(const dns_rdata_t *rdata, void *target, isc_mem_t *mctx);
509/*%<
510 * Convert an rdata into its C structure representation.
511 *
512 * If 'mctx' is NULL then 'rdata' must persist while 'target' is being used.
513 *
514 * If 'mctx' is non NULL then memory will be allocated if required.
515 *
516 * Requires:
517 *
518 *\li 'rdata' is a valid, non-empty rdata.
519 *
520 *\li 'target' to point to a valid pointer for the type and class.
521 *
522 * Result:
523 *\li Success
524 *\li Resource Limit: Not enough memory
525 */
526
527void
528dns_rdata_freestruct(void *source);
529/*%<
530 * Free dynamic memory attached to 'source' (if any).
531 *
532 * Requires:
533 *
534 *\li 'source' to point to the structure previously filled in by
535 * dns_rdata_tostruct().
536 */
537
538bool
539dns_rdatatype_ismeta(dns_rdatatype_t type);
540/*%<
541 * Return true iff the rdata type 'type' is a meta-type
542 * like ANY or AXFR.
543 */
544
545bool
546dns_rdatatype_issingleton(dns_rdatatype_t type);
547/*%<
548 * Return true iff the rdata type 'type' is a singleton type,
549 * like CNAME or SOA.
550 *
551 * Requires:
552 * \li 'type' is a valid rdata type.
553 *
554 */
555
556bool
557dns_rdataclass_ismeta(dns_rdataclass_t rdclass);
558/*%<
559 * Return true iff the rdata class 'rdclass' is a meta-class
560 * like ANY or NONE.
561 */
562
563bool
564dns_rdatatype_isdnssec(dns_rdatatype_t type);
565/*%<
566 * Return true iff 'type' is one of the DNSSEC
567 * rdata types that may exist alongside a CNAME record.
568 *
569 * Requires:
570 * \li 'type' is a valid rdata type.
571 */
572
573bool
574dns_rdatatype_iszonecutauth(dns_rdatatype_t type);
575/*%<
576 * Return true iff rdata of type 'type' is considered authoritative
577 * data (not glue) in the NSEC chain when it occurs in the parent zone
578 * at a zone cut.
579 *
580 * Requires:
581 * \li 'type' is a valid rdata type.
582 *
583 */
584
585bool
586dns_rdatatype_isknown(dns_rdatatype_t type);
587/*%<
588 * Return true iff the rdata type 'type' is known.
589 *
590 * Requires:
591 * \li 'type' is a valid rdata type.
592 *
593 */
594
595isc_result_t
596dns_rdata_additionaldata(dns_rdata_t *rdata, dns_additionaldatafunc_t add,
597 void *arg);
598/*%<
599 * Call 'add' for each name and type from 'rdata' which is subject to
600 * additional section processing.
601 *
602 * Requires:
603 *
604 *\li 'rdata' is a valid, non-empty rdata.
605 *
606 *\li 'add' is a valid dns_additionalfunc_t.
607 *
608 * Ensures:
609 *
610 *\li If successful, then add() will have been called for each name
611 * and type subject to additional section processing.
612 *
613 *\li If add() returns something other than #ISC_R_SUCCESS, that result
614 * will be returned as the result of dns_rdata_additionaldata().
615 *
616 * Returns:
617 *
618 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
619 *
620 *\li Many other results are possible if not successful.
621 */
622
623isc_result_t
624dns_rdata_digest(dns_rdata_t *rdata, dns_digestfunc_t digest, void *arg);
625/*%<
626 * Send 'rdata' in DNSSEC canonical form to 'digest'.
627 *
628 * Note:
629 *\li 'digest' may be called more than once by dns_rdata_digest(). The
630 * concatenation of all the regions, in the order they were given
631 * to 'digest', will be the DNSSEC canonical form of 'rdata'.
632 *
633 * Requires:
634 *
635 *\li 'rdata' is a valid, non-empty rdata.
636 *
637 *\li 'digest' is a valid dns_digestfunc_t.
638 *
639 * Ensures:
640 *
641 *\li If successful, then all of the rdata's data has been sent, in
642 * DNSSEC canonical form, to 'digest'.
643 *
644 *\li If digest() returns something other than ISC_R_SUCCESS, that result
645 * will be returned as the result of dns_rdata_digest().
646 *
647 * Returns:
648 *
649 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
650 *
651 *\li Many other results are possible if not successful.
652 */
653
654bool
655dns_rdatatype_questiononly(dns_rdatatype_t type);
656/*%<
657 * Return true iff rdata of type 'type' can only appear in the question
658 * section of a properly formatted message.
659 *
660 * Requires:
661 * \li 'type' is a valid rdata type.
662 *
663 */
664
665bool
666dns_rdatatype_notquestion(dns_rdatatype_t type);
667/*%<
668 * Return true iff rdata of type 'type' can not appear in the question
669 * section of a properly formatted message.
670 *
671 * Requires:
672 * \li 'type' is a valid rdata type.
673 *
674 */
675
676bool
677dns_rdatatype_atparent(dns_rdatatype_t type);
678/*%<
679 * Return true iff rdata of type 'type' should appear at the parent of
680 * a zone cut.
681 *
682 * Requires:
683 * \li 'type' is a valid rdata type.
684 *
685 */
686
687bool
688dns_rdatatype_atcname(dns_rdatatype_t type);
689/*%<
690 * Return true iff rdata of type 'type' can appear beside a cname.
691 *
692 * Requires:
693 * \li 'type' is a valid rdata type.
694 *
695 */
696
697unsigned int
698dns_rdatatype_attributes(dns_rdatatype_t rdtype);
699/*%<
700 * Return attributes for the given type.
701 *
702 * Requires:
703 *\li 'rdtype' are known.
704 *
705 * Returns:
706 *\li a bitmask consisting of the following flags.
707 */
708
709/*% only one may exist for a name */
710#define DNS_RDATATYPEATTR_SINGLETON 0x00000001U
711/*% requires no other data be present */
712#define DNS_RDATATYPEATTR_EXCLUSIVE 0x00000002U
713/*% Is a meta type */
714#define DNS_RDATATYPEATTR_META 0x00000004U
715/*% Is a DNSSEC type, like RRSIG or NSEC */
716#define DNS_RDATATYPEATTR_DNSSEC 0x00000008U
717/*% Is a zone cut authority type */
718#define DNS_RDATATYPEATTR_ZONECUTAUTH 0x00000010U
719/*% Is reserved (unusable) */
720#define DNS_RDATATYPEATTR_RESERVED 0x00000020U
721/*% Is an unknown type */
722#define DNS_RDATATYPEATTR_UNKNOWN 0x00000040U
723/*% Is META, and can only be in a question section */
724#define DNS_RDATATYPEATTR_QUESTIONONLY 0x00000080U
725/*% Is META, and can NOT be in a question section */
726#define DNS_RDATATYPEATTR_NOTQUESTION 0x00000100U
727/*% Is present at zone cuts in the parent, not the child */
728#define DNS_RDATATYPEATTR_ATPARENT 0x00000200U
729/*% Can exist along side a CNAME */
730#define DNS_RDATATYPEATTR_ATCNAME 0x00000400U
731
732dns_rdatatype_t
733dns_rdata_covers(dns_rdata_t *rdata);
734/*%<
735 * Return the rdatatype that this type covers.
736 *
737 * Requires:
738 *\li 'rdata' is a valid, non-empty rdata.
739 *
740 *\li 'rdata' is a type that covers other rdata types.
741 *
742 * Returns:
743 *\li The type covered.
744 */
745
746bool
747dns_rdata_checkowner(const dns_name_t *name, dns_rdataclass_t rdclass,
748 dns_rdatatype_t type, bool wildcard);
749/*
750 * Returns whether this is a valid ownername for this <type,class>.
751 * If wildcard is true allow the first label to be a wildcard if
752 * appropriate.
753 *
754 * Requires:
755 * 'name' is a valid name.
756 */
757
758bool
759dns_rdata_checknames(dns_rdata_t *rdata, const dns_name_t *owner,
760 dns_name_t *bad);
761/*
762 * Returns whether 'rdata' contains valid domain names. The checks are
763 * sensitive to the owner name.
764 *
765 * If 'bad' is non-NULL and a domain name fails the check the
766 * the offending name will be return in 'bad' by cloning from
767 * the 'rdata' contents.
768 *
769 * Requires:
770 * 'rdata' to be valid.
771 * 'owner' to be valid.
772 * 'bad' to be NULL or valid.
773 */
774
775void
776dns_rdata_exists(dns_rdata_t *rdata, dns_rdatatype_t type);
777
778void
779dns_rdata_notexist(dns_rdata_t *rdata, dns_rdatatype_t type);
780
781void
782dns_rdata_deleterrset(dns_rdata_t *rdata, dns_rdatatype_t type);
783
784void
785dns_rdata_makedelete(dns_rdata_t *rdata);
786
787const char *
788dns_rdata_updateop(dns_rdata_t *rdata, dns_section_t section);
789
790ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
791
792#endif /* DNS_RDATA_H */
